Shadow education secretary Andy Burnham said the report backed the views of teachers and parents who want Michael Gove to "rethink his backward-looking curriculum policy". The Tory-chaired committee warns that Michael Gove 's plans for a narrow 1950s-style curriculum could lead to young people switching off from learning, playing up in the classroom and finding themselves unprepared for the modern workplace, he said. The Liberal Democrats were committed to localism long before devolving power became fashionable with all parties. Indeed, the whole thing is hardly a new idea. As church leaders tell government ministers with a smile: We've been doing it for 2,000 years. Part of the problem is that Mr David Cameron has not defined it.
